abstract: Independent advocacy group New Yorkers for Parks releases its first report card on New York City’s large parks; most parks earn a respectable B average, with some lagging because of factors like poor lawn care or lack of working drinking fountains.
snippet: On their new report cards, New York City’s large parks turn out to be solid performers, earning a respectable B average.
lead_paragraph: On their new report cards, New York City’s large parks turn out to be solid performers, earning a respectable B average.

headline.main: Most City Parks Earn Solid Marks, With Some Lagging
headline.print_headline: Most City Parks Earn Solid Marks, With Some Lagging
headline.seo: Most City Parks Earn Solid Marks, With Some Lagging
